text: Hello everyone, where we can see "Internal Names" of properties and objects in HubSpot. Please help me out.

Hi, if you go to the properties in settings under Data Management, select your object from the drop-down and you can view the list of properties on there. If you click on the property you want to see the internal name of you can see with the '</>'.
Thank You so much <@U069GTW198R>
welcome :)
<@U069GTW198R> Can you tell me where i can see objects "Internal Name" ?
if you click on the property on the list of properties it will open the side window to edit the property.  In the top right there is a symbol that looks like this '</>' click that.
i am not able to find
Hi everyone. I am new in this channel - Greetings from Hong Kong
I am looking for Custom Code resources. May I know which channel is the best place for that?
I am not public app developer.
Just learning Custom Code for now.
I read the API doc but it is beyond my knowledge.

Hi everyone,
A client of ours is not satisfied with the security of the X-HubSpot-Signature auth header for public app CRM cards, do you know any other ways to manage the security of a public app CRM card ?

The client suggested whitelisting HubSpot servers so that we are sure that the request comes from HubSpot but I can’t seem to find any information about this, do you know if HubSpot IPs are fixed (for CRM card requests) ?

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.

Hi!
Im trying to make a select dependent field, like cities and then show another select only with the shops of this city, but i cant achieve that. Is it possible ?
Im using dependent logic fields, but it doesnt works
But always show all options not only Barcelona in this case
Thanks!

What we have done historically is create folders for each category (for ex,Events), we create list within folder that has event name (eg -- Gartner), if it event we create static list and if form dynamic list. We load members into lists either manually or automatically through form fill, we treat membership as a campaign response. I think HubSpot moving away from folders, so we looking for best practice aligned with HubSpot strategy. We also want to pull the lists, contacts, and date added to list via API, but it unclear if that COntact List v1 api something we should use or avoid. It also confusing now that you can just associate contacts to forms because it now creates multiple patterns and we looking for common pattern. HubSpot experts. Help!
Create a workflow and add a Custom Code widget - it will start you will some sample code (see screenshots).  Read more here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/workflows/custom-code-actions>
I have not personally used this yet, but there is a Marketing Events category in the CRM API: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/marketing-events>
